page.title: 03Education in Colmonell
page.content: The only educational establishment in Colmonell at present is the village primary school. As the village population has declined so too naturally has the school roll. At present there are only 11 pupils in the school,although this would appear to be on the increase. There is only one full time member of the teaching staff,the Headmaster,and he is responsible for the education of all the pupils at the school whose ages range from 5 to 12 years of age. The children enjoy a wide range of educational activities and also take part in a rambling club and a sports club after school hours. At the age of 12 the pupils transfer to Girvan Academy,some 12 miles away. They are transported to Girvan by the local community bus.
